description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Import Compliance Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

The Logistics Trade Compliance team makes sure physical deliveries happen compliantly and on schedule so Google's virtual world keeps humming. As a member of the team, you will help provide operational import compliance guidance to business units, customs brokers, freight forwarders and other logistics service providers. From global deployments of servers to the delivery of networking gear, you will often partner with other teams to make sure that such imports take place compliantly, meeting corporate compliance standards. You will also work with internal and external partners to measure and define trade compliance processes, constantly using data to improve and strengthen controls.

In this role you will also assist subject-matter experts, business units and other cross-functional stakeholders on the operational activities to meet corporate trade compliance requirements. You will interact and influence internal customers and management at all levels throughout a large, geographically dispersed company.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of industry experience.
  • Experience with U.S. and Canada customs compliance fundamentals. Experience operationalizing CBP’s and CBSA’s regulations and requirements.
  • Experience with U.S. and Canada non-government requirements (e.g., FCC, FDA, NRCAN, etc.).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Excellent analytical and project management skills.
  • Experience working in a collaborative and cross-functional environment, both domestic and international.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced business environment with frequent and rapid priority changes.
  • Action and results-oriented and a hardworking, motivating team player.
  • Excellent verbal and oral communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Provide support for key business units and their strategic initiatives.
  • Perform day-to-day trade compliance activities, including ensuring timely clearance instructions are provided and problem shipments are addressed.
  • Review and determine applicability of shipments.
  • Assist business units with implementing trade compliance requirements into relevant business practices and processes.
title: Import Compliance Manager
